intro: Tephroseris kawakamii, commonly known as the Kawakami's tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
